Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw a fish and the water it lives in.
The student can label the parts of the habitat that the fish needs, such as water, rocks, or plants.
The student can show how the fish uses its environment to meet its needs, such as swimming in water and finding food.
The student can illustrate other plants or animals that might live in the same habitat as the fish.
The student can demonstrate with labels how the fish and the habitat form a system that works together.
